So far, most of the social network’s top executives have been silent.
Facebook has built its highly profitable social network off its users, selling advertisements based on their ages, interests and other details.
Politicians in the United States and Europe are calling for its chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, to testify before them.
Mr. Zuckerberg, its founder, and Sheryl Sandberg, his top deputy, have not made any public statements in recent days.
The pair did not appear at an employee meeting on Tuesday in Menlo Park, Calif., where the company is based.
Investors have cut the value of the social networking giant by about $50 billion in the past two days.
WASHINGTON — Federal regulators and state prosecutors are opening investigations into Facebook.
They are all focused on the same thing: whether Facebook mishandled users’ data.
